camel.source.endpoint.amazonKinesisClien.name: camel.source.endpoint.amazonKinesisClient
camel.source.endpoint.amazonKinesisClien.description: Amazon Kinesis client to use for all requests for this endpoint

camel.source.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient
camel.source.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking

camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Kinesis client

camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Kinesis client

camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Kinesis client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.source.endpoint.region.name: camel.source.endpoint.region
camel.source.endpoint.region.description: The region in which Kinesis Firehose client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.source.endpoint.trustAllCertificat.name: camel.source.endpoint.trustAllCertificates
camel.source.endpoint.trustAllCertificat.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.iteratorType.name: camel.source.endpoint.iteratorType
camel.source.endpoint.iteratorType.description: Defines where in the Kinesis stream to start getting records One of: [AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER] [AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER] [TRIM_HORIZON] [LATEST] [AT_TIMESTAMP] [null]

camel.source.endpoint.maxResultsPerReque.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxResultsPerRequest
camel.source.endpoint.maxResultsPerReque.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.sequenceNumber.name: camel.source.endpoint.sequenceNumber
camel.source.endpoint.sequenceNumber.description: The sequence number to start polling from. Required if iteratorType is set to AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER or AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

camel.source.endpoint.shardClosed.name: camel.source.endpoint.shardClosed
camel.source.endpoint.shardClosed.description: Define what will be the behavior in case of shard closed. Possible value are ignore, silent and fail. In case of ignore a message will be logged and the consumer will restart from the beginning,in case of silent there will be no logging and the consumer will start from the beginning,in case of fail a ReachedClosedStateException will be raised One of: [ignore] [fail] [silent]

camel.source.endpoint.shardId.name: camel.source.endpoint.shardId
camel.source.endpoint.shardId.description: Defines which shardId in the Kinesis stream to get records from

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.amazonKines.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.amazonKinesisClient
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.amazonKines.description: Amazon Kinesis client to use for all requests for this endpoint

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.autoDiscove.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.autoDiscoverClient
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.autoDiscove.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxyHost
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Kinesis client

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxyPort
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Kinesis client

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxyProtoc.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.proxyProtoc.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Kinesis client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.region.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.region
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.region.description: The region in which Kinesis Firehose client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.trustAllCer.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.trustAllCertificates
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.trustAllCer.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.bridgeError.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.bridgeError.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.iteratorTyp.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.iteratorType
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.iteratorTyp.description: Defines where in the Kinesis stream to start getting records One of: [AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER] [AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER] [TRIM_HORIZON] [LATEST] [AT_TIMESTAMP] [null]

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.maxResultsP.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.maxResultsPerRequest
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.maxResultsP.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.sequenceNum.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.sequenceNumber
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.sequenceNum.description: The sequence number to start polling from. Required if iteratorType is set to AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER or AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.shardClosed.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.shardClosed
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.shardClosed.description: Define what will be the behavior in case of shard closed. Possible value are ignore, silent and fail. In case of ignore a message will be logged and the consumer will restart from the beginning,in case of silent there will be no logging and the consumer will start from the beginning,in case of fail a ReachedClosedStateException will be raised One of: [ignore] [fail] [silent]

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.shardId.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.shardId
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.shardId.description: Defines which shardId in the Kinesis stream to get records from

camel.component.aws2-kinesis.basicProper.name: camel.component.aws2-kinesis.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.aws2-kinesis.basicProper.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
